name: SPDR S&P Metals and Mining ETF
description: The SPDR S&P Metals and Mining ETF (GNR) is an exchange-traded fund designed to track the performance of the S&P Metals and Mining Select Industry Index. This ETF focuses on companies involved in the extraction and production of metals and mining resources, which include a variety of sectors such as precious metals, base metals, and diversified mining. GNR provides investors with a diversified portfolio that includes some of the largest companies in the metals and mining industry, including those that produce gold, silver, copper, and other essential metals. The fund aims to offer exposure to the performance of the metals and mining sector, which is influenced by global economic trends, commodity prices, and demand for industrial materials. By investing in GNR, investors gain access to the potential growth and profitability of the metals and mining sectors, which can serve as a hedge against inflation and currency fluctuations. This ETF is particularly appealing to investors looking to gain exposure to the resource sector without the need to manage individual stocks. As a part of the SPDR family of ETFs, GNR is designed with low expense ratios and high liquidity, making it an efficient vehicle for investors looking to diversify their portfolios.

products: SPDR S&P Metals and Mining ETF (GNR)

seo.meta_title: SPDR S&P Metals and Mining ETF (GNR) | Investment in Metals Industry
seo.meta_description: Invest in the SPDR S&P Metals and Mining ETF (GNR) for exposure to the metals and mining sector. Track the performance of leading companies in the industry.

faq.question: What does GNR stand for?
faq.answer: GNR stands for SPDR S&P Metals and Mining ETF.

faq.question: What is the focus of the GNR ETF?
faq.answer: GNR focuses on companies involved in the metals and mining industry, including precious and base metals.

faq.question: Where is GNR headquartered?
faq.answer: GNR is managed by State Street Global Advisors, headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, USA.
